title: Simulation-Based Social Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social science theory and understanding of research methodologies
context.additional_context: Learners experience solving complex social problems in VR simulations via personal devices, practicing metacognition by comparing clear and ambiguous examples. Project-based assessments measure real-world application abilities.

learning_goals: Learners can compare clear and ambiguous task examples in diverse social problem scenarios to select optimal problem-solving strategies.
Learners can enhance their ability to analyze complex social problems and systematically design solutions in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can recognize ambiguities in their problem-solving processes through project-based assessments and develop self-reflective skills to overcome them.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
